etymology.description: semantic: 氵(氵) (shuǐ, "water") + phonetic: 工(工) (gōng, from its Old Chinese pronunciation) = water-related meaning reinforced by phonetic component -> river
etymology.interpretation: The character 江(江) (jiāng, "river") combines the water radical 氵(氵) (shuǐ, "water") with the phonetic component 工(工) (gōng). This combination signifies a large body of water, fitting the meaning "river."

examples.chinese: 这条江水流湍急(這條江水流湍急)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè tiáo jiāng shuǐ liú tuān jí.

examples.chinese: 江面上漂浮着渔船(江面上飄浮著漁船)。
examples.pinyin: Jiāng miàn shàng piāo fú zhe yú chuán.
examples.english: Fishing boats float on the river surface.

examples.chinese: 夜晚月光映在江上(夜晚月光映在江上)。
examples.pinyin: Yè wǎn yuè guāng yìng zài jiāng shàng.
examples.english: At night, the moonlight reflects on the river.
